title: Nossa Senhora da Boa Hora (Capelas de)
original_title: Nossa Senhora da Boa Hora (Capelas de)
body:
The chapel of Nossa Senhora da Boa Hora is located in the area of Torre, in the parish of Câmara de Lobos, and is owned by the Countess of Torre Bela (1921). It was founded by the landowner António Correia Bettencourt Berenguer. It had a private chaplain. With the same name, 'above this city', there was a chapel built in 1726 by Captain António de Carvalho Drumond and his wife D. Inacia Micaela Henriques, with the endowment deed dated May 22, 1726.

In the area of Fajã, in the parish of Arco da Calheta, a chapel was erected dedicated to N. S. da Boa Hora, of which only a few ruins remain.

1726: Construction of the chapel by António de Carvalho Drumond
